Constructor Detail

Application

public Application()
Instantiates a new application.

Method Detail

addShape

public void addShape()
Adds the shape to the ArrayList of shapes by cloning the current shape and calling addShape in the DrawPanel. The Application is repainted after adding the shape so that the user can see the changes they made.

empty

public void empty()
Calls the empty function in DrawPanel and then repaints the window so user can see the changes..

getBrush

public Shape getBrush()
Gets the current brush, used for drawing the shape.

Returns:
the brush

getColor

public java.awt.Color getColor()
Returns the current color the user has chosen.

Returns:
the color the user chose

load

public void load(java.io.File toLoad)
Calls the load function in DrawPanel, passing the filename the user chose along with it so the program knows where to load the file from, and which file.

Parameters:
toLoad - the file to load

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
The main method, only contains one line, to start running the program.

Parameters:
args - the arguments

redo

public void redo()
Call the redo function in DrawPanel so that the last shape the user removed from the screen is added back. Repaint the window so user can see the changes.

save

public void save(java.io.File toSave)
Calls the save function in DrawPanel, passing the filename the user chose along with it so the program knows where to save the file.

Parameters:
toSave - the file to save

setBrush

public void setBrush(Shape newShape)
Sets the brush to whatever shape the user chooses, this is selected in the ButtonPanel

Parameters:
newShape - the new brush

setColor

public void setColor(java.awt.Color toSet)
Sets the color to whatever color the user chose when they hit the choosecolor button in the ButtonPanel.

Parameters:
toSet - the new color to set

undo

public void undo()
Call the undo function in DrawPanel so that the last shape the user added to the screen is removed. Repaint the window so user can see the changes.
